properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from Okaloosa-Walton County Line to Pensacola FL out 20 NM; Waters from Okaloosa-Walton County Line to Pensacola FL from 20 to 60 NM; Coastal waters from Pensacola FL to Pascagoula MS out 20 NM; Waters from Pensacola FL to Pascagoula MS from 20 to 60 NM
properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued February 6 at 8:53AM CST until February 6 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Mobile AL
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Coastal waters from Okaloosa-Walton County Line to Pensacola FL out
20 NM...
Coastal waters from Pensacola FL to Pascagoula MS out 20 NM...
Waters from Okaloosa-Walton County Line to Pensacola FL from 20 to
60 NM...
Waters from Pensacola FL to Pascagoula MS from 20 to 60 NM...

* Until 1000 AM CST.

* At 853 AM CST, a strong thunderstorm capable of producing
waterspouts was located 34 nm southwest of Oriskany Reef, or 41 nm
south of Perdido Pass, moving northeast at 55 knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts to 40 knots.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally
hazardous seas. Small craft could be damaged in briefly
higher winds and suddenly higher waves.

* Locations impacted include...
Oriskany Reef.
properties.instruction:
A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon CST for northwestern
Florida...and the adjacent coastal waters.
